description.narrative: (Democratic Republic of the Congo): .The goal of this activity is to strengthen the capacity of Congolese institutions and communities to deliver quality, integrated health services, sustainably reduce maternal and child deaths, and combat infectious diseases. IHP supports the DRC government's goal to provide essential health services for women and children. Encompassing malaria, maternal and child health, nutrition, family planning and reproductive health, tuberculosis, and WASH, this mechanism serves nearly 41 million people, or 30 percent of the Congolese population in nine provinces. IHP works to strengthen health systems and governance at provincial, health zone, facility, and community levels; increase equitable access to quality, integrated facility- and community-based health services; and foster adoption of healthy behaviors. IHP will: 1) increase capacity to plan, implement, and monitor, services at the provincial, zonal, and facility levels; 2) strengthen disease surveillance and strategic information gathering and use; 3) increase access to and appropriate use of essential health services and commodities, in coordination with USAID's supply chain investments; 4) support minor refurbishments to and equipping of health facilities to ensure their readiness to provide quality, lifesaving services; 5) improve health provider practices in support of respectful care; and 6) address care-seeking barriers (including gender-related) in collaboration with Breakthrough Action. IHP will use collaboration, learning, and adaptation to ensure the continuity of essential health services in the face of COVID-19 and other shocks and stresses that threaten to disrupt core health system functions. IHP will also support and document innovation and scale-up of high-impact interventions to foster healthier, more resilient, and more productive communities. Resilient communities are essential to advancing USAID/DRC's next CDCS, the Journey to Self-Reliance, and USG interests in
